metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4678 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The safe_eval function in Ansible before 1.6.4 does not properly restrict the code subset, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted instructions. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-4657. It was discovered that Ansible mishandled certain input. A remote attacker could use this to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2014-4678` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 1.6.6+dfsg-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> This CVE was the result of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-4657

criterions.comment: ansible package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.6+dfsg-1').
